intro: Putranjiva formosana, commonly known as the Formosan sea hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Taiwan. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and large, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and sandy soils. Its leaves are ovate with a smooth surface, and the flowers are usually pink or red, blooming during the summer months. Putranjiva formosana plays a role in local ecosystems and is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations.
